content: tea time cozy ⇀ ↼ the tea time cozy is a quick and attractive little to-go cup cozy it is a two-toned project for a confident beginner or immediate-level crocheter m aterials worsted weight yarn ex red heart super saver - main color - accent color 5 00mm crochet hook h 5 5mm crochet hook i tapestry needle a bbreviations chain chain slip_stitch slip_stitch single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet increase increase s s pecial titches into third loop in a half_double_crochet stitch the third loop is found just behind the top v that is formed by the front loop and back loop that you usually work in when crocheting insert your hook into this third loop and crochet as directed this creates a nice braided border look here is a great photo and video tutorial created by moogly to give you a visual https //www mooglyblog com/third- loop-half-double-crochet/ puff insert hook into stitch and pull up a loop 2 loops on hook yarn over insert hook into stitch and pull up a loop 2 times you will have 6 loops on your hook yarn over and draw through all 6 loops on the hook n otes - most of this pattern is worked in joined rounds with the right side facing you do not turn your work at the end of the round unless instructed to - you can increase or decrease the number of stitches to adjust the size of your cozy just be sure to have an even number of stitches otherwise the puff rounds and the top edging will not join smoothly - when switching yarn colors you may carry the non-working color on the inside of the cozy … or you may cut the non-working color leaving a length to weave in page �1 of �3 © warm n fuzzies by amy 2021 tea time cozy pattern foundation chain with size h hook and main color loosely chain 31 optional go up one hook size to make chain as a looser chain will make the back bumps easier to find slip_stitch into first chain to join in the round being careful not to twist the chain chain 1 round 1 working into the back bumps of your foundation chain half_double_crochet into the same stitch as slip_stitch in previous row then in each st around slip_stitch into the first half_double_crochet of the row to join chain 2 31 st round 2 working in the third loop of the previous row half_double_crochet into the same st as slip_stitch half_double_crochet into the third loop of each st around work 2 half_double_crochet increase in final st slip_stitch into the first half_double_crochet of the row to join chain 1 32 st round 3 working in the third loop of the previous row single_crochet into the same st as slip_stitch single_crochet into the third loop of first 15 st work 2 single_crochet increase into third loop of next st single_crochet into third loop of each st to the end then work 2 single_crochet
